data.title: Synopsys proceeds with Ansys acquisition, notifies China regulator By Investing.com
data.meta_description: Synopsys proceeds with Ansys acquisition, notifies China regulator
data.text:
Synopsys (NASDAQ: ) Inc., a leader in software services, has moved forward with its planned acquisition of Ansys (NASDAQ: ) Inc., notifying Chinaâ€™s market regulator as it seeks global approvals. The notice to the State Administration for Market Regulation of the People's Republic of China, filed on July 10, 2024, was a step toward satisfying conditions for the merger, which is poised to close in the first half of 2025.

The merger, announced on January 15, 2024, under an Agreement and Plan of Merger, will see Ansys become a wholly owned subsidiary of Synopsys. Despite being below the notification thresholds set by the Chinese State Council, Synopsys was advised to file a notification. The merger is contingent upon the receipt of necessary regulatory approvals and customary closing conditions.

The merger is part of Synopsys' strategy to expand its portfolio and capabilities. Ansys, known for its engineering simulation software, would bolster Synopsys' offerings in the integrated circuit (IC) design and software security sectors. The combination is expected to create a powerhouse capable of delivering advanced solutions critical for developing electronic products and systems.

Investors and stakeholders are closely watching the merger's progress, as the combined entity would likely influence the competitive landscape of the software services industry. Synopsys, which trades on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker SNPS, has been preparing for the integration of Ansys' operations and product lines, aiming to capitalize on the synergies the merger could offer.

The transaction's progress will be documented in filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), including a registration statement on Form S-4, which was declared effective on April 17, 2024. The SEC filings are available to the public and provide detailed information about the merger process.

This news is based on Synopsys' recent SEC filing and reflects the company's ongoing efforts to expand its global reach and technological capabilities.

In other recent news, Synopsys experienced significant developments in its operations and financial performance. The company's earnings and revenue results for the second quarter of 2024 showed a 15% year-over-year increase in revenue to $1.45 billion and a 26% surge in non-GAAP earnings per share. Analyst firms Piper Sandler, Baird, and KeyBanc have respectively raised their price targets for Synopsys to $687, $661, and $690, maintaining positive ratings on the stock.

In terms of company news, Synopsys unveiled the first complete PCIe 7.0 IP solution, a significant milestone in data transfer technology for AI and high-performance computing data centers. The company also announced the availability of its AI-driven multi-die reference flow and Synopsys IP for Intel (NASDAQ: ) Foundry's embedded multi-die interconnect bridge technology, aiming to expedite the design and production of heterogeneous multi-die systems.

These recent developments reflect Synopsys' robust financial performance and promising trajectory in the semiconductor industry. The company's efforts in advancing chip design technologies, coupled with its strong financial results, have positioned it favorably for future growth. However, as always, investors are advised to consider these facts in the context of their overall investment strategy.
